Reviews.Title: “What you would expect”
Reviews.Author: Stoneleigh
Reviews.Content: This is a 3 star hotel. The rooms are small (typical Venice) but with a comfortable and clean bed. It lacks electric sockets. The bathroom is ok. Breakfast is an average continental with little imagination or style. Very convenient for St Marks and Rialto so worth putting up with the weaknesses.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, reasonably priced, unique charm”
Reviews.Author: chirp333
Reviews.Content: I really liked our stay at the Hotel Canaletto last March / April. The hotel is actually in a great location as everybody has already posted: walking distance to the Rialto bridge area (4-5 minutes) walking distance to the Piazza San Marco (4-5 minutes) very quiet area -- you will hear the noise level drop 50% or more the moment you step in from San Lio street to the inner courtyard area where the hotel is. very near a lot of food shops / pizzeria / gelateria that are open until late -- especially on San Lio, there was a good gelateria nearby (almost right outside the small street you emerge from) with reasonable price, there's a restaurant next door, and take out pizza in either direction after exiting the hotel. Hotel was reasonably priced as well Decorations in the hotel were pretty classic styled, but the bathrooms were actually VERY modern and brightly lit! Some of the rooms may seem darker because the lights take a long time to warm up and the walls of the room might be covered with dark silk decoration, but otherwise it was okay! If you come here during winter time though, you may want to bring slippers as the marble floor can be really cold!!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect central location...authentic classic Venetian room!”
Reviews.Author: Ilycep
Reviews.Content: Location is in walking distance of everything..easy to get to from the water taxi...cute venetian style room. Great breakfast. Only complaint is the two single beds with separate sheeting put together, not the most comfortable for a couple. Also shower and bath is very small. However for value for money and location I would be back and do recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Very good location and helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: HOXA61
Reviews.Content: We stayed 5 nights at the Canaletto last summer (August 2011). The room was booked through hotels.com. When we arrived in the evening we got a comfortable room but since the room was facing a tiny inner courtyard it was dark and felt a bit claustrophobic. I thought that there was no chance that we would be given another room since it was in August and the room was already paid for with no possibility to a refund. The man behind the reception desk spoke excellent English and told us that the hotel was fully booked but he went through their booking list and found another room which would be vacant from tomorrow. When returning in the afternoon the next day the staff had moved our baggage and belongings from our old room to our new room. The new room was so much nicer, airy and bright. This hotel takes good care of their guests and the staff behind the reception desk were always friendly and helpful. Good breakfast. Agree with other posters that the location is superb. The hotel was easy to find despite it's quiet location since there was a sign in the "main street" from the Rialto bridge pointing out the direction.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty average for the area”
Reviews.Author: Rachelbeans
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed 5 nights at Hotel Caneletto last week. My only major complaint is the comfort of the beds. Ok, yes, I'm an American who enjoys memory foam and pillow top, but seriously, these mattresses are like wood. I don't think we slept straight through a single night. We kept waking up trying to shift around to find a comfortable position that didn't leave our shoulders and hips numb. That said, they're pretty typical for a 3-star European accommodation. Upgrade to a Mercure if you're serious about bed comfort. And while we found the hotel staff friendly and helpful, and the breakfast buffet perfectly adequate and the coffee even very good, I would also caution that when the hotel says it has "fully air-conditioned rooms," that is not necessarily so. There was some sort of fan-ish A/C-looking thing above the door, but the first night we ran it, it started making dying noises around 3am. We live in Europe now and can also attest to the fact that Europeans in general do not trust A/C. So probably this contraption had never been run through an entire night. And anyway, it wasn't putting out cold air. A/C in this context means: "possibly functional room-temp air blower." Since it was early April, we were able to sleep with the window open, but at the cost of a mosquito invasion - a tolerable hassle. This hotel is in an excellent location, and unless you are a high-maintenance traveler or have mobility problems (no elevator, narrow stairs only), you will enjoy your stay!

Reviews.Title: “great location BUT rock-hard bed”
Reviews.Author: mentos1999
Reviews.Content: I would like to disclose an American is writing this review. I state this because our standards of comfort are different from those of our European cousins. Pros: - Great location, 10 minute walk or less to St. Mark's and Rialto. - Good continental breakfast with rolls, cheeses and meats, cereal options, the coffee was delicious - Staff member mans the desk 24/7 Cons: - Hard, hard bed. We could not sleep well on the rock slab of a bed in our room (queen sized bed) - WIFI, we paid 5Euros to use the Wifi for 24 hours (not consecutive hours but cumulative time). However, often I only had one bar of wifi in the bedroom. I saw other guests had to use their laptop next to the check in counter to receive adequate wifi coverage. - no A/C, it said the rooms were air-conditioned but we found a fan ventilation type system which did not adequately cool the room. Honestly, we did not need A/C in April, it was cool outside. Unfortunately, when we opened the windows, mosquitos came in during the night and feasted on our flesh. If we closed the windows, the room became oppressively stuffy. The first night we ran the A/C unit all night to recirculate the air but were awakened by a weezing sound from the machine. Thereafter we did not run it during the night. - safe, although there was a safe in the room, it was not large enough to put my MacBook Pro laptop in. So, again to review. Great location, good breakfast, helpful staff but very uncomfortable beds which made it difficult to get a good night's sleep.

Reviews.Title: “Excelent location, quiet hotel, very clean room”
Reviews.Author: Aldo45
Reviews.Content: The best thing about this hotel is its location: 5 minutes from Rialto bridge, 5-7 minutes from San Marco square and 10 minutes from Fondamente Nove (in case you want to travel to Murano/Burano/Torcello islands). Although centraly located, the hotel is very quiet, which is very important from my point of view. Although very small, the rooms are kept very clean (daily cleaning and towels change) and have nice old furniture, venetian style. You can also use the minibar and the lcd tv if you like. I spent 6 days in this hotel, all the 3 receptionists were very friendly, whenever asked they were wiling to help with sugestions about shortcuts, cheaper places to eat etc. All of them spoke english, french and german. Breakfast was much better than other places in Italy, they had butter, 3 types of cheese, 2 types of ham, salami, milk, cereals, juices, tea, jam, croissants, cakes, fruit salads, different kinds of bread and also a toaster. The only thing missing were the eggs, but it was not such a big problem. You could serve it from 8 till 10 o clock. Beware that checkout in this hotel is from 11 o'clock. Also, do not forget about the city tax, 3 euro/person/night in high season and 1,5 euro/person/night in low season. I had a wonderfull time here, I would say it's definitelly a very good choice.

Reviews.Title: “Romance and high quality at Hotel Canaletto!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Maria B
Reviews.Content: We stayed there from the 9th to the 13th of February during the carnival period. It was very very cold but our room was warm, water was always hot, room was playful and impecable. It had a fabulous mezzanine with a VERY comfortable bed. Overlooking a small canal, it has been tastefully decorated in the venitian style a bit over the top with chandeliers and murano apliques everywhere! The walls are made of silk fabric. We LOVED it! The staff was friendly, the location couldn't be better at a jumping distance from Rialto or St. Marcs. What can I say... value for money. We spoiled ourselves and it was worth it!!! Bottle of Prosecco waiting as we came in the room impressed my husband (I preordered it when I made my booking, it was his birthday) If you have the money GO SPEND IT AT HOTEL CANALETTO!!!! THEY ARE WORTH EVERY PENNY!!! GRAZIE!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, but noisy:(”
Reviews.Author: Nata_85
Reviews.Content: It was very difficult to find the hotel - I understand that is always very difficult to find something in Venice especially when you're visiting this city from the first time, but at least the hotel stuff at the booking stage - could give the directions! The only thing, which was written at our booking blamk was: it is 5 minutes away from Rialto bridge, and that's all.. so we were looking for the hotel, having two really heavy bags for 30 mins or so... I kindly ask the stuff - to give correct directions for the visitors!!! The first impression about the hotel was very positive - very nice and romantic room, very cosy and nice, good location, close to all sightsseeing places, we managed to get to everything on foot, did not take vaporetto to get to some places. But the impression changes as soon as the evening appears. Well, our room unfortunately had windows, which faced the cafe on the first floor and it was SO NOISY THERE!!! That we couldn't sleep by 1 am. First night the group of Franch students was having fun in the cafe by midnight, so we coudn't sleep by that time... the other night spanish students were having fun down next to the cafe by 1 am and it was a real nightmare! Well, we are young as well, but not everyone is eager to listen to the crazy noiuse by 1 am, while you're trying to fall asleep... what really shocked me is that the hotel stuff, hearing this sound and noise even did not come to these guys and did not ask tem to be quiter or to move to another place! But despite this our stay in Venice was OK, the hotel stuff is OK, the breakfast is nice. I highly recommend you - when you book this hotel - ask for rooms, which do not face this cafe...

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location of a lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: Bojanov
Reviews.Content: Me and my family, we stayed for a week in this nice hotel. It's located right between St Marks Square and Rialto in the center of the islands of Venice. Could be a good point for a family with small children, because decreases the distance to the main landmarks of Venice . At the same time situated in a quiet square, near a commercial street with a lot of possibilities to find restaurants, pizzeria or shops. The hotel staff is was friendly and helpful. The room was big enough and clean. The breakfast - corresponding to a 3 stars hotels. If one day I come back to Venice, I will choose again in this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Venice style - small room.”
Reviews.Author: PapaInternational
Reviews.Content: Hard beds and hard single pillows. Room too hot. Turned off heat completely. No fruit at breakfast. But clean and nice staff.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place and great location.”
Reviews.Author: Alessandro S
Reviews.Content: Very nice place incredibly close to both S. Marco and Rialto. Stuff was friendly and very helpful too. Room wasn't massive but clean and with a very conformable bed. Breakfast nice but not amazing. Of course it was a bit over price but in Venice this is how it works!

Reviews.Title: “excellent location”
Reviews.Author: Effie L
Reviews.Content: Canaletto hotel is situated close to the most important sightseeings. I would never think of taking vaporeto in order to go to the other side of town. You could go everywhere on foot. Close to railway station, Rialto bridge and S. Marco. A quiet, very clean hotel, with a touch of romance inside the rooms. It is totally understood that not all the rooms haven't got nice view. Good breakfast buffet, though I would prefer orange juice. Lack of knowledge of english language from the girls who served breakfast and cleaned the rooms is not a good point. I had to learn Italian!!! Sth I did not appreciate Anyway it was a pleasant stay. Effie Spyros Irene Yiannis Athens Greece 18/01/2012.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet corner”
Reviews.Author: Glenis C
Reviews.Content: This hotel is tucked away in a little courtyard, which can be tricky to find on arrival, but is a welcome respite from the crowds on the main thoroughfares. We arrived at night by the ferry and followed the hotels instruction to ask a waiter how to get to the hotel - which was successful on the first attempt! The room was a good size (european standard), but a little dark and although you could look down to the street from the window there wasn't any outlook. The upside of this was that it was very quiet, with just the occasion noise of a boat coming into the nearby canal. The room itself was old fashioned in style but attractive and while my partner liked the bed, I found it a little hard. The staff were helpful and carried my heavy bag up the stairs for me, which I appreciated. The breakfast offered was good and you could sit out in front of the hotel in the afternoon sun. There were several good restaurants literally around the corner and it was an easy walk to the main canal. We'd stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Really lovely.”
Reviews.Author: Olivia H
Reviews.Content: This hotel is really good. It's located right between St Marks Square and Rialto (3 minutes walking, once you know which alleyways to take). The room could probably use with an update, but it still had true Italian character. Bathroom was spacious and clean. One downside was that our TV didn't work properly (it didn't seem to have digital activated, even though it said it was available, so we only had 3 blurry channels available), but you're in Venice to see Venice, not watch TV so it wasn't a problem. Breakfast was good: the usual breads, pastries, cold meats, cheese, cereals; but was still very good. Would definitely recommend this hotel to those who want a nice, affordable and central hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Needs a serious revamp”
Reviews.Author: Frencquez
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Canaletto may be one of the cheapest, it is also one of the most run-down. The room I was given featured a bad smell of still waters and some walls had marks of decay. Furniture and equipment needed also to be renewed. Breakfast was good, including the service of hot beverages (coffee, tea, hot chocolate).

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Stay At The Hotel Canaletto”
Reviews.Author: thornabydon
Reviews.Content: Excellent long weekend stay at this hotel , our room was very clean and well furnished the bathroom was very clean the bath was only half the size of the normal bath but that was nothing to moan about it did it's job , The staff where very helpful and friendly breakfast was very good , the hotel is well located it felt central to everthing within a ten minute walk the taxi from the airport ( speedboat ) drops you more or less right out side your hotel a great expereince would i stay again ..................YES I WOULD

Reviews.Title: “Once you've found it, great location”
Reviews.Author: KiwiHJC
Reviews.Content: Good hotel, easy walk to St Marks Square, Rialto Bridge & water buses. Reception staff were helpful and twin room ok size.

Reviews.Title: “Great place with wonderful desk people”
Reviews.Author: moejoe61
Reviews.Content: Were there for a short stay in September, the front desk help, especially Igor were remarkable helpful, setting up travel to Murano and a water taxi to our cruise ship. Even helped take our bags to the bridge to meet the taxi. If I were to ever make it back to this wonderful city, I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: Vicki P
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed 2 nights in Hotel Canaletto in Sept. A little trouble finding, but not to bad. Rooms are small and the shower does leak all over the floor, but the location makes up for all of this. The staff is very nice and accommodating. Breakfast is the usual Italian fare. We liked that it was off the beaten path, which made it very quiet. Easy walking distance to all the sites, and near some great restaurants...check out De Mamo...a great little place with delicious food and delightful wait staff. All in all, this hotel worked well for us.

Reviews.Title: “Just returned...”
Reviews.Author: Phillip W
Reviews.Content: Perfectly located...so close to St Mark's but in a quiet nook. GREAT staff all day and night. Had a group of 22 there on 9, 10, 11 Oct, 2011...would go back tomorrow !

Reviews.Title: “perfect stay”
Reviews.Author: birgit_72_11
Reviews.Content: we stayed there for 3 nights in late August; very nice hotel, very friendly front desk staff, good breakfast, perfect location inbetween Piazza san Marco and Rialto - close enough to return to the hotel in the afternoon to escapye from the summer heat, take a shower, refresh and continue exploring the city an hour later or so; I very much liked it!

Reviews.Title: “First Time Travelers in Italy”
Reviews.Author: asp53
Reviews.Content: This hotel was an OK place to stay in Venice. The rooms were very small as were the beds. One strange thing we noticed is that there was only one shower door...every time we used the shower, water ran all over the floor. We did not stay in any other Italian hotels like this. The one saving grace of our stay here was Igor at the desk. He was so helpful & spoke English quite well. He made our stay more tolerable.

Reviews.Title: “Very convenient between the bridge and main city square, 5 minute walk on either side of center of Venice”
Reviews.Author: PRATHAPA
Reviews.Content: Small , but nice facility, clean and good staff. Located in centrally situated area. Important ferry stations on either side of hotel. All major historical centers situated in walking distance. Rooms all right , but location is excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel in convenient location”
Reviews.Author: WillTravelonGravel
Reviews.Content: Hotel was nice and clean. Internet access required payment but was quite poor where we stayed. Outside of that the two-level room for four was good. Convenient location to the usual spots in Venice. Helpful staff. Decent breakfast. Cappuccino was weak.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great people, great everything, I loved it”
Reviews.Author: capousa
Reviews.Content: This Hotel, is in a great location, 4 minutes from san marco, very clean, breakfast is good, rooms are nicely decorated, staff are great, iwould recommend everyone

Reviews.Title: “I'm QUITE sure you can do better”
Reviews.Author: ka_schmeer
Reviews.Content: I have stayed now at several hotels across Italy and this was by FAR the worst one. I also want to say that we are pretty easy going people. We're not expecting the Ritz and we know that European hotels are a whole different standard from Canadian and American hotels. But this place was so bad that it became a running joke! Every time something else happened or we noticed something else we'd just look at each other and say, "Tripadvisor!" Before anything else, if you want to risk having your things stolen, go to this hotel. They require you to leave your keys at the front desk when you leave, but then store them in labeled cubby holes behind the desk. No one checks your ID when you come in and ask for your key and there are always different people at the desk. So, in other words, if I come in off the street, I can look up and see that room 125 has keys in it, which means the owners aren't around. I can ask for those keys, they will give them to me without a second thought, I can proceed to go to the room and rob them blind. Needless to say, we kept our valuables with us at all times. The room itself was an alright size, except for the washroom which had a shower so small, you couldn't move in it. I can barely explain this shower as it was SO terrible. It had two plastic, push in doors. One of them didn't open properly because it would hit the bidet. Neither of them closed properly. If you turned on the water it would spray out onto the floor, which means you have to climb into the shower and close the doors before turning on the water and just deal with the freezing water until it warmed up. The doors were covered in mold in all the creases and the shower was so small that if you turned you would either hit the door open, or knock the facet handle, switching the water temperature. There were no racks or anything to put soap or shampoo, which meant it needed to be kept on the floor. Imagine how fun it is to bend over in a shower like that??? I'm a small girl, but my husband is almost six feet! The sheets were alright, but the blankets on the bed were just dirty and gross and had rips in them. Blankets in the closet were no better, they looked like they'd never been washed EVER. The pillows (there were only two) were so thin, there may as well have not been any! I used my neck pillow from the plane. My husband was jealous and woke up with a stiff neck. I think I remember them saying that the rooms are soundproof. IF they say that, it is a lie. First of all, the walls are covered in fabric(?), but the windows are regular windows. Our room faced the front and underneath is an alley and a restaurant, which was open very late. It would get very noisy and one night we had the pleasure of hearing someone puking outside. In the morning the restaurant and our hotel would drag out the metal chairs and tables, making another racket. Breakfast is served from 8-10. You'd think in two hours they could manage to serve a decent breakfast, but the first morning we came out around 9am and there was no food. Seriously! Nothing was left. None of the restaurant workers seemed in any rush to refill anything either. I finally had some stale rice krispies in warm milk. They have mini danishes, which look like they were poured from a bag (and tasted that way too). They had one left, I let my husband have it. The next morning we came much earlier and it was marginally better. If you are an older individual or in a wheelchair, there is no elevator, only one of those chairs that goes up the stair banister. It was broken when we were there though, so I wouldn't rely on that. The location is good, very central, but this hotel just purely sucks! I stayed in two star hotels in Italy that were WAY better than this place. There is NO way this place should be labeled as a three star hotel! If you have to pay a bit more, DO IT. And if you are delusional enough to think this hotel was fantastic, well I hope you don't get robbed. If you're a robber! Hey...easy pickings!

Reviews.Title: “Not the Ritz, but a decent value”
Reviews.Author: bobyankee
Reviews.Content: We visited the Hotel Canaltto in July 2011 and paid $160 per night. I was worried about finding the hotel but had no problem since I followed the directions listed on TripAdvisor in one of the reviews. We took the Alilaguna Orange Line from Marco Polo Airport to Rialto. It cost 15E but if you purchase the tickets online in advance, the cost is 13E. There is one bridge you must cross to get to the hotel so be aware that you will have to carry your luggage up and down stairs. Hotel Canaletto is located on a small, interior courtyard between St. Mark's Square and Rialto Bridge, away from bury foot traffic areas. Upon arrival, Marco, the hotel clerk arranged for someone to bring our luggage up to our room. There are not elevators and we were on the first floor. He also gave us a map of Venice and a brief orientation. The room was small but it overlooked the square. The wallpaper needed replacement and the TV was 12 inches and the reception was snowy with only BBC and CNN in English. The bed was two twins put together but was comfortable. We asked for and received extra pillows. The bathroom was ok. It had a bidet, which we didn't use. Putting toilet paper in the toilet was not permitted so we had to put it in the waste basket. Paper was dispensed in 2 square at a time. The shower had no curtain and you had to hold the nozzle to rinse off which made it inconvenient. Shampoo was provided but no conditioner. A very small piece of soap was also provided. Breakfast was fine. Coffee, croissants, rolls, cold cuts (must be a European thing) and cereal. We asked the night clerk for some boiling water to make tea and he was kind enough to provide it. All in all, a decent place to stay but certainly not the Ritz.

Reviews.Title: “We will be back for a third time”
Reviews.Author: TheRoyalcouple
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in 2009 for our honeymoon and loved it so much that we booked it again for this trip. Management were very helpful and even upgraded us for being a return booking. We got a beautiful suite with a bungalow bed upstairs and overlooking the canal. Only one mild complaint was we couldn't watch tv from the bed but hey we aren't here to watch tv. Lol. We will book here again if we come back to Venice. Thanks guys for the memorable stay.

Reviews.Title: “Venice”
Reviews.Author: kahana_10
Reviews.Content: This hotel was easy to reach from Rialto and St. Marks water bus stops. The rooms were clean and nicely decorated but rather small. Breakfast was not great but the staf was very helpful and nice.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent family orientated Hotel”
Reviews.Author: nickplan
Reviews.Content: Hotel Canaletto is a lovely place to stay. Very clean.Quiet and relaxed. Great for couples yet very family orientated. Spacious family room. Great location. Few minutes walk from St Marcs Square and close to the Rialto Bridge. We were really impressed by all the friendly and helpful staff especially Marco, who gave us so much help and valuable advise about where to go and what to do. Nothing was too much trouble. We had a great time. Well recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Great service and location”
Reviews.Author: Nonnie185
Reviews.Content: Located on a canal with gondolas and lots of restaurants close by, the caneletto provided great location to go either to the Rialto or the. Plaza San Marco. Marco At reception was very helpful. Tutta bene

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful people work there! They helped us much and just saved us”
Reviews.Author: Divinora
Reviews.Content: We didn't live there actually, but we just want to say many thanks to people who work in Hotel Canaletto. Here is our story. We booked a room in Hotel Caneva a few months before our arrival to Venice but when we came there they told us that our booking is cancelled and they do not have a room for us. A man who worked there refused to help us and said it wasn't his problem, so we went to find another hotel somewhere near. But we already know that we hardly could find a hotel in the cener of Venice for that price... But we tried our luck and came to Hotel Canaletto. A woman at reception desk listened to our story and tried to help us, despite the fact that we just came from the street. She spent almost an hour for us and find a great solution for us! So we spent a wonderful time in Lido and Venice, instead of sleeping under the bridge... I'm sure that if you stay in Canaletto you will love it! Because the location is great - near to all must-see places and, once again, the staff is very helpful and nice! Thank you!

Reviews.Title: “Central location, dated dÃ©cor and awful breakfast”
Reviews.Author: qu_tee
Reviews.Content: Personally this hotel was not to my taste at all, the dÃ©cor was dated and whist trying to be impressive, it seemed like a lacklustre attempt to offer something from the Marie Antoinette era. Check in was relatively quick but it is the first place I have stay at where I had to leave my passport with them for a while to complete the registration. I was not completely comfortable with this, but we had to rush off for a tour so didnâ€™t really have a choice. The room itself was a decent size but that is about as positive as it gets. There was no view worth mentioning from our room, the bathroom was large but the bath/shower was a strange shape and didnâ€™t allow much standing space, there was weak water pressure, the shower screen was poor and by the end of my shower there was water all over the floor. The TV in the room was small and there was no tea or coffee making facilities. The actual room itself was also very dusty and I didnâ€™t even want to put my phone directly on the side table (I put a tissue under it), the room phone was filthy and there was a used shower cap left in the bathroom. Not to mention the air-conditioning did not work! Our booking also included breakfast which was very, very ordinary. The offering was minimal and someone I travelled with said they serviced the worst coffee he had drunk in Italy! All I had for breakfast was some pre-diluted juice and 2 mini chocolate pastries. Bottom line is I wouldnâ€™t stay here again especially for the price paid.

Reviews.Title: “Well located, very pleasant, friendly and helpful English speaking staff.”
Reviews.Author: snapdoggy
Reviews.Content: We were able to leave for our return to the airport via water taxi that picked us up at a canal just a few feet from the hotel's front door.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, nice rooms, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: dsmulligan
Reviews.Content: My husband and I traveled to Rome, Venice and Florence. Of the hotels, this one had the nicest reception area and room. And it was the only one with a full-size shower! It's centrally located (although anywhere you stay in Venice is pretty much centrally-located) and near the Rialto ferry line which can easily take you to the train station or airport. For the price, this is a pretty good option. Pros: clean, centrally-located, full-size shower & tub, quiet, helpful staff, price Cons: no elevator (for us, this was only an issue during check in and out), dark rooms

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel & fantastic location!!”
Reviews.Author: Wink79
Reviews.Content: Not only is this hotel a step back into the 17th century but it a fantastically modern facility with a wonderful complimentary breakfast. Although it is slightly difficult to find you will appreciate being off the beaten path and away from the crowded streets of Venice. The hotel staff was very helpful and friendly and went out of their way to help with transportation back to the airport at the end of our stay. they even packed us a breakfast to take with us since we had to check out of the hotel at 3am to catch our flight!! I strongly recommend this hotel and I absolutely loved the decor!! The only down-side was the price we paid for the hotel room but that was because we stayed during a holiday weekend (Easter) and the rates for all hotels were very expensive. Staying during the off-season (October through December) will drastically reduce the room rates and is worth every penny!!

Reviews.Title: “Great service-shame about the rooms”
Reviews.Author: Sightseers_5
Reviews.Content: We took a water taxi from Marco Polo Airport, which dropped us off at Rialto Bridge. Got horribly lost trying to find the hotel, but once we knew our way it didn't seem too bad. Like the other reviews- we found Marco at reception very helpful. Rooms were very small, though were still clean and tidy. Breakfast was typical of Venice- pastries, breads, cheese, tinned fruit. The hotel was easy distance to St Mark's square and lots of other tourist places, though away from all the noise. Restaurants that we found good were: San Zulian (San Marco, 523) just off from St Mark's Square- there was hardly anyone in there! Great garlic bread with the meal as welll as the standard rolls. Another was Caffe La Piscina which was round the back of Santa Maria della Salute overlooking the water. ** Top Tip**- on the way back to the airport we managed to get a water taxi to collect us about 50m from Hotel Canaletto- a neighbouring hotel had a entrance onto the canal that we could use, which saved us lugging our bags through Venice. Ask at the reception desk.

Reviews.Title: “If only the charm of the rooms had equaled the excellent service!”
Reviews.Author: WITraveller251
Reviews.Content: After reading the reviews on Tripadvisor, we braced ourselves for the challenge of finding this hotel. We were, however, pleasantly surprised to find it as easily as we did! The hotel is very clean, and very well situated. The room lacked charm, but had perfectly adequate facilities. I can't say enough good things about the staff, though! Marco, at the front desk, went above and beyond to make check-in easy, and spent time with us to be sure we understood exactly how to find our way to the airport in time for our very early morning departure. When we left in the early-morning hours, the staff was prepared for our departure and insisted we take a sack breakfast along with us. We especially appreciated the extra help - and the food - since we had enjoyed the nearby Devil's Forest English pub into the wee hours of the morning. I would heartily recommend this location to anyone looking to spend some time in Venice!

Reviews.Title: “excelent location, greatfull atmosfere”
Reviews.Author: adrian1301
Reviews.Content: To stay to this hotel was a great pleasure and a nice way to discover Venice! I'm very happy for the hospitality, which was very pleasant. Unfortunly, this time i must stay only 3 days, but in future i'l stay more, because Venice it's a great place to spend holliday and this hotel it's so nice and confortable. The room was excelent, the cleaning too, and the breakfast it's great! I'm very exciting about this experience, because i traveled a lot in Europe and in Italy and here, at this hotel, i found very good conditions to stay and to visit. I'm happy for chosing this hotel and i'll use it all time i'll come in Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in a great location!”
Reviews.Author: SManRG
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel in Feb 2011. I was booked into a single room, but they gave me a double for single use when I got there (not sure if they actually have single rooms?) The room was nice, not enormous, but big enough, with a double bed (actually two twins pushed together), a little desk, a wardrobe (with quite a few hangers yay! and a safe), a minifridge concealed in a little cupboard, a TV (which I didn't switch on at all) and an ensuite, with a shower, toilet, bidet, sink, lit mirror and hairdryer. It was nice, done in a Rococo style (which I happen to like, some people may think it is a little fancy and girly) and comfortable, and very clean. The cleaners who came in every day to the room must have also changed the bedspread every day as I spilt a little drink on the cover which wasn't noticeable unless you knew, and when I came back later that day it was gone, which I have noticed is not common practice in every hotel. There was an air conditioner/heating panel in the room too, but the temperature was fine and I didn't use it. The front desk staff was very nice too, efficient and charming. They spoke excellent English,and I think I heard them speaking French and German too. I happen to speak a little Italian which was nice to be able to communicate in their native language, but would've been absolutely fine if I didn't. Breakfast was a standard Italian style, cereals, fruits, yoghurts, toast and rolls and crackers and spreads, pastries, little ham slices. There were juices and water, and a woman came round and took drinks orders for tea/coffee. If you would like a cappucino/latte/espresso/hot chocolate etc they will happily make one. Be aware, sometimes in Italy (particualrly in a cafe or patisserie) if you order a 'caffe' (coffee) you may get an espresso as standard. If you want a filter coffee you want to order a Caffe Americano, or American coffee. For milk, in either tea or coffee add 'con latte' (pronounced lah-tay) to your order. I The breakfast room did fill up quickly, there are only about 40 or so seats, and after 9am it did fill up. It is self service apart from hot drinks. which you tell the woman for. There is no restaurant in the hotel, but there is a restaurant next to the hotel called Cantina Canaletto, which I think offered a substantial discount to guests, although I didn't fully check it out. The location of the hotel is really good, about 5 minutes walk from the Rialto and Piazza San Marco. It is a vibrant area full of life, but it tucked away so you do feel in a quiet peaceful street. It is really easy to get around Venice either on foot or on vaporetto, which are the city waterbus system, which you can buy 12,24,48 or 72 hour travelcars for, or pay for single hour long tickets. Vencie can seem like a labyrinth maze of little alleys, but unless you are headed for somewhere hard to find and spoecific do not worry too much about maps (although the hotel did give a really good one on check in) as there are yellow signs directing you back to Rialto or San Marco, where you will easily be able to find the hotel. To find the hotel from the Rialto vaporetto stop walk towrds the bridge as if you were going to walk over it but turn right at the base, you will go past a bureau de change (cambio) and into a sqaure (Campo San Bartolomeo) on the opposite side of the square there is a shop called Stefanel, next to that is a bar called Nostra, and then there is an alley, and then a bank. Go down the alley between Bar Nostra and the bank, past a chocolate shop called Dolcemara, and over a bridge where there is bathroom fittings shop, and onto the street called Sallizada San Lio. After 50m on the right, you will see the sign for Hotel Canaletto, just before the Fujifilm shop, opposite Boutique di Gelato (which does great gelato incidentally). Turn down this alley, through a small square where you need to bear left (there is a sign on the wall painted something about Kaya) and you will then see the hotel on your left. All in all, a very nice hotel in a great location!

Reviews.Title: “Almost perfect!”
Reviews.Author: Clive97
Reviews.Content: Great position, lovely and efficient staff, great breakfast and a good room- what more could a traveller want? Well....hot water for a shower in the morning would make this the perfect stay in Venice. It' s warm enough if you get up sometime after 8am but those wanting to make an early start should be prepared for a luke- warm wash rather than a refreshing shower. Perhaps there was something wrong with the hot water service?

Reviews.Title: “Can't Wait to Return - Would Love to Stay Here Again!”
Reviews.Author: lipsticktraces
Reviews.Content: Great location half way between St. Mark's Square and the Rialto Bridge. Wonderful staff (English speaking). Room is quiet, cute and comfortable. Wi-fi is fast and reliable (extra charge; and/or 30 min. free daily). Breakfast was super: excellent pastries, Italian cold cuts, cheese, rolls/breads, fruits/juices, cereals and divine coffee made to order! The hotel's restaurant is very good too -- I had some incredible pumpkin gnocchi I'm still dreaming about. Bonuses: easy access to transport/walking to great sites, inexpensive supermarket is 100 paces away (towards St. Mark's Square), fantastic restaurants steps away (Taverna San Lio is top rate!), also many fast coffee/bars to choose from. (TIP: Google maps is wrong. From airport, take orange line and get off at Rialto stop. Turn left along the Grand Canal; go up and down a few staircases and find the base of the Rialto bridge. With the bridge to your back, walk straight until you see the statue of Carlo Goldoni in Campo San Bartolomeo. Cross the campo, and move to your left. You'll see an entrance that has a neon sign over it reading "Rotisserie." Enter this corridor and keep walking straight. Pass over one bridge and walk further, looking for the restaurants "Marco Polo" and "Taverna San Lio" (they'll will be on your right). Just after the Taverna, you'll see a tiny sign over another alleyway that reads "Hotel Canaletto." Walk through this alley into a tiny square. You'll see a restaurant in front of you. Continue on past the restaurant (to it's left) and you'll find the Hotel Canaletto.)

Reviews.Title: “second time around”
Reviews.Author: travelalways41
Reviews.Content: This was our second visit to venice and the Hotel Canaletto and we received the same outstanding service and another pleasant encounter with the staff from the desk to the breakfast room. The hotel was quiet and had old world charm which added to another memorable Venice experience. The hotel is centrally located between the Rialto Bridge and San Marco square. Happy visitors from Fredericksburg, Virginia, USA

Reviews.Title: “thank you very much Hotel Canaletto”
Reviews.Author: bahtiyar
Reviews.Content: location is perfect. crew is so friendly. value, service and room quality are good.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, ask for Marcos”
Reviews.Author: Dspbob
Reviews.Content: We were here during Thanksgiving. This is the rain and high tide season. We got about 50% sunny days. Other day, S Marcos was flooded a few hours each day. It is need to watch this effect. The whole place carries on. Rain boots was needed in a few area we visited. Excellent seafood trattorias are in the area, ask around! We even bought the 72 hours pass and got around to Murano Island, make sure you catch the sun set. It is very romantic. Jiao,...This is how the locals says it....

Reviews.Title: “Good Location”
Reviews.Author: CoveCobra
Reviews.Content: We had the previously written difficulty in finding the hotel, but once we did it was then easy to get to San Marco and Rialto Bridge. The first thing we noticed was an unusual smell in the lobby and corridors. It was there each day we were there. The room itself was OK smell wise. The room whilst not being overly large was comfortable and clean. The room opened onto a small courtyard was which was terrific. Breakfast was a cold Buffett, but there was plenty to eat. Overall this hotel served the purpose in a great city.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel for the price”
Reviews.Author: Ottawa_07
Reviews.Content: Large room for Europe, great breakfast. We had a very difficult time to find the hotel but once we knew where it was, we were able to find it. Wi-Fi isn't free. Some staff were helpful and others not as much .NOTE: no lift. Considering the price, we would recommend this hote. A big THANK YOU to the person who worked at the front desk, the morning of Sep 19 at 5am. He was extremly helpful and nice.

Reviews.Title: “What a pleasure!”
Reviews.Author: Sandi47
Reviews.Content: A wonderful surprize to be greeted by friendly staff(not like we were used to in Rome!) Also, very refreshing to have staff actually help us with our bags from the taxi and back to the taxi. Very rare in Europe! Stunning breakfast included as well (not the usual bread roll and coffee). Special mention for Marco who welcomed us and couldnt do enough during our stay. We will go back to Venice, and most definitely stay at the Canaletto again! Sandi Burger - South Africa

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Canaletto is like staying in a Fairytale”
Reviews.Author: Sharon255060
Reviews.Content: Close to San Marco & Rialto Bridge, however tucked away which made it almost sound proof. The hotel decoration is exactly like the photographs and the staff are all welcoming, friendly and helpful. The restaurant next door is open until late and great for a glass of wine or coffee after eventually finding our way back home via the small streets and alleyways. This does not only apply to Hotel Canaletto, the entire city is a maze, a wonderful maze.

Reviews.Title: “Definately THE perfect hotel for your stay in Venice!”
Reviews.Author: BrizzieMum
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my daughter and we were very happy with everything. It is a very charming little hotel, very quiet, very close to all the shops, restaurants, the Rialto Bridge, gondola rides etc It is also very easy to find and once you've been to Venice you'll know that's definately a good thing! The staff were wonderful and very helpful, taking our bags to our rooms for us, giving advice on transport etc. The rooms are beautiful, very comfortable and very clean, air conditioning (it was summer and very hot!) There was a great selection for breakfast, pastries, rolls, cereal, yoghurt, fruits etc I would definately recommend this hotel for your stay in Venice!

Reviews.Title: “Lacks cleanliness and any facility . Only plus is the location.”
Reviews.Author: Sylesh
Reviews.Content: Arrived today and took nearly 45 mins to find the place . The guy at the so called reception was rude and didn't really want to help . There was no lift andnobody offered to help with our baggage. Thankfully our room was on floor 1 . The room was extremely small with absolutely no space to put our bags. A small ancient portable tv and some dirty bed covers greeted us . The room was warm but the bathroom was ok . The telephone looked like it wasn't dusted for years. No power strips ; we had to unplug tv and lamps to charge our electronics. I am yet to try the breakfast but the place didn't look too appealing however we met this guy called Igor at the front desk when we returned at night and he was very helpful . He is by far the only good thing at the hotel . The rest if it is just unbelievably bad for the money we paid. I wanted to write a review so others would benefit .

Reviews.Title: “Bello”
Reviews.Author: rsanchezm
Reviews.Content: A very nice hotel, cute, romantic, kind employees and a perfect location in the most beautiful city in the world

Reviews.Title: “good location but NOT good value for money,Breakfast is a shame”
Reviews.Author: paccacuregge
Reviews.Content: location is very good just 5 min from S.Marco and Rialto but hotel honestly is a 2 stars with really basic breakfast just a cheap bread jam butter and coffee or tea in a very small bkf room , there isn't the elevator , about the room , furnitures are cheap and bathroom need to be strongly renouved , i think they buildeb the bathroom near 1970 and from this time they didn't renouve it, for the price that i paid i will not recommend you to go there, real value for this hotel will be 60-70 euro for a double room

Reviews.Title: “In a good position”
Reviews.Author: Quilterliz
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel Canaletto for 3 nights in June, we were on holiday in Europe and Venice was one port of call. We are 3 adults (Mum and two grown sons). The hotel is in a great location, only 5 minutes one way to the San Marco Plaza and 5 minutes the other way to the Rialto bridge. Hotel was clean and the breakfast was reasonable, had trouble with the stairs on the right hand side of the hotel to get to the first floor, no rail only wall on one side, the 6 or so steps are steep and found it hard to lug heavy baggage up them. The guys on the reception desk spoke English which was helpful, though only one of them was really friendly. One was quite rude, made a point of not speaking to us when we came in or when we were leaving to go off sightseeing. Room was clean though small as we had three single beds in the room, bathroom was ok, though it got very hot in there as there are no exhaust fans. Would not stay there again, but would like to thank the tall slim man with curly brown hair at reception as he went out of his way to be helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Service during and After stay!!!!”
Reviews.Author: dradd
Reviews.Content: A great location and very quiet hotel for Venice! Also terrific service from all the staff! Happy to recommend restaurants and things to do, but not pushy at all! A week after we returned home I realized that I had forgotten my necklace in the room. I emailed Alessandro and they had found it and it was soon back in my hands in Nova Scotia!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, not so great hotel”
Reviews.Author: sallyannethomas
Reviews.Content: I visited Venice and stayed in the Hotel Canaletto with my daughter and a male friend to celebrate her 21st birthday. When we eventually found the hotel (not easy) there was no welcome reception, we were given our key and that was that - no information on breakfast time, facilities or anything! The room was dark, tiny and dingy. We had booked a triple room but were given a tiny double with a fold away bed in which blocked off the wardrobe, dressing table and chairs leaving very little space to move around. My friend is 6'3" and 16 stone so a flimsy put up bed didn't make him feel particularly at ease. Having said this, the bathroom was very good and everything was kept spotlessly clean. The location is perfect only a few mins walk from both the Rialto and St Marks Square. Breakfast was average, you had to wait for everything - a clean glass, a knife, a pastry it seemed the hotel could not keep up with demand. I have visited Venice on many occasions but would not consider this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Value in Venice”
Reviews.Author: M0rley
Reviews.Content: CANALETTO HOTEL, VENICE. The Canaletto Hotel is ideally situated in a quiet little street, midway between the Piazza San Marco and the Rialto Bridge. From the reception desk to the buffet breakfast rooms and the room service, not forgetting the night watchman, all the staff are invariably cheerful, warmly welcoming, charming and always willing to help.Almost all the staff have been together for over ten years and have put all their considerable experience into looking after their guests. Thus the whole hotel has a delightful, family, "home-from-home"atmosphere. Small wonder that we have stayed here nine times during the past ten years and wouldn't dream of staying anywhere else in Venice.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel , great location , great staff - a real taste of Venice”
Reviews.Author: BuryStEdmundsSeb
Reviews.Content: we fell in love with Venice in the winter time - no crowds , friendly locals , dazzling light etc , and found the Canaletto by chance , what a find !! Tucked away in a quiet street with a canal at the end , the hotel offers a taste of the real Venice , away from the crowds of St Marks & the Rialto , but only a few minutes walk from both . The staff are very friendly & helpful , and have been there a long time , which is always a good sign ; the rooms are smallish , but then it is the heart of Venice , not some souless chain out in Mestre. Surrounded by shops and restaurants , you do not have to go far for anything , and the Rialto water bus stop is a few minutes walk , which is great when yoiu have luggage . We have stayed here 10 years on the trot , and it feels like a second home !

Reviews.Title: “NICE HOTEL, GREAT LOCATION”
Reviews.Author: engo10
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 3 nights and found the hotel to be very nice and well decorated, if you're into that sort of thing. The staff were friendly, the rooms were clean and most importantly the bathroom was perfect. Amazing shower, very very powerful, which I love so that was nice. Although My partner woke up on the first morning complaining of bed bug bites all over her body. I wasn't too convinced, that is until the final morning I woke up with 7-8 all over my body. We couldn't tell if the sheets had been changed as the bed was made each day. This was a bad thing. I'm still suffering. The breakfast is also the worst I have ever seen in a hotel. I'll actually go as far as saying it was horrible. Even the tea and the coffee were a shambles. Not worth getting up for or if you are up early then I suggest you skip it. Other than that, the place was nice. No bar though which was abit disappointing and also no wi-fi. Great location. Once you find it, which may take a while you'll be fine for the rest of the trip. Would I stay here again? Yeh probably, it's good value for what you are getting.

Reviews.Title: “Good , well located 3 *** just a shame about the lack of Wi-Fi”
Reviews.Author: theterminator65 Posted by an OctopusTravel traveler
Reviews.Content: Hotel Canaletto.... what can I say: good central location - perfect for me as I came for the last few days of the Biennale... really close to all central areas. Everybody loves Venice, it's our favourite theme park, trouble is you get nailed just about everywhere you go.... I only paid Â£87 on-line (easy hotels) for my 2 nights at the Canaletto, so that was a steal as I could have paid Â£30 a night in a fleapit hostel. Room was good, en-suite good, Breakfast was a good buffet spread, Staff were friendly but not lavishly so. One major complaint..... no Wi-Fi : just about everywhere has free W-Fi these days.... even the campsite I went to in Sardinia last summer.... not the Canaletto though. They tell me it's due soon...... check first...!

Reviews.Title: “Quaint hotel, but not worth the price”
Reviews.Author: CDNGlobeTrotter
Reviews.Content: Canaletto Hotel is located in the heart of Venice, so it is convenient for getting to and from the hotel while exploring the many alleyways and streets of the city. It is located near Rialto bridge and can be easily traveled to, but I recommend using the Google walking directions as that helped me find it and Venice can be quite confusing. The staff wasn't too friendly, but they were somewhat helpful when I had questions. The breakfast was a typical continental style. The hotel offers a computer with internet connection at 1 euro per 10 minutes but no wifi.

Reviews.Title: “Great location...average service”
Reviews.Author: Frankie066
Reviews.Content: The hotel is centrally located; 5 minutes' walk from Ponte di Rialto and 3 minutes' walk from Piazza San Marco IF you know the way. But we got lost and it took us almost 45 minutes to find the hotel. When we told the guy at the reception desk he wasn't particularly sympathetic about our situation. We had a very spacious room overlooking one of the inner canals. The room was quiet, clean and nicely decorated. However, we realised the next morning that below our room was the garbage collection area. When we arrived back at the hotel that afternoon, we could smell garbage. We asked for some air freshener from the reception desk but the guy said they didn't have any air freshener. He came around to our room to check but told us that he couldn't smell anything bad. We had to use our own parfum to spray the room each day for the rest of our stay. One of the two hotel websites (www.hotelcanalettovenice.com) states that this is a family run hotel. The service is actually not too bad (certainly better than the hotel we stayed in Firenze - see our review posted on 15 October) but one would certainly expect much better service from a family run hotel. And considering it is not that cheap.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location”
Reviews.Author: Chiara92
Reviews.Content: Stayed here the last week in September. The Location was perfect once you get your bearings,close to san marco.rialto and strada nuova. The room was clean and more spacious than expected..airconditioning thank god! a real must in Venice.The breakfast left a bit to be desired..little selection and the coffee by anyones standards (not alone Italian standards) was truely awful! Staff were freindly and over all couldn't complain.

Reviews.Title: “Little Gem in the Heart of Venice”
Reviews.Author: BrownKettering
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Hotel Canaletto in July 2009 for 2 nights and found it to be very clean and comfortable. The room was more spacious than we expected after having read about hotels in Venice having tiny rooms. There is a small reception and breakfast room, but being out all day, we didn't need anything more. Breakfast was adequate and the staff very helpful and friendly. It is just a few minutes walk from both the Rialto bridge and St Marks Square which is ideal when you have luggage to drag from the boat. Don't follow the Google map as it puts the hotel in the wrong place! Use the hotel directions and you will probably still get lost, but its easy when you have done it once! Overall this hotel is very good value for money in Venice and we would be happy to return.

Reviews.Title: “Frilly rooms, Great location!”
Reviews.Author: Heleone
Reviews.Content: We stayed for three nights at this hotel right in the "heart" of Venice. Location is EXCELLENT, just a few minutes walk from Rialto Bridge on one side and Piazza San Marco on the other. The rooms are extremely frilly - think Laura Ashley goes bezerk - but are neat and tidy, and we got real linen towels beside the terry bath towels! The hotel itself feels a bit worn out and there's a slighty smell of reeking smoke, even though smoking is prohibited nowadays. The rooms are not fully soundproof, but not so much that it really bothers. The beds are pretty hard. Breakfast was not really to our liking; no fresh fruits or vegetables what so ever, and mainly sugary jams for the white breadrolls, but I guess it's the Italian way. The hotel has a "sister" with a restaurant just off Rialto Bridge, where you get a 10% discount as a guest at Canaletto, but I would rather spend my money on dinner somewhere else, since the food was pretty poor, as was the service there (for instance, our waiter interrupted and left right as we were ordering, to show another guest to his/her table!) Nice and helpful staff in the hotel reception, and a computer with free Internet near the small lobby (There was a sign saying it's 1 â‚¬/10 minutes to go online, but we didn't have to pay anything. The staff has to log in though, according to Italian anti-terrorist regulations...?) To sum up; you do get what you pay for - no more, no less. You could easily find a better hotel, but probably not at this relatively low cost at this location - and you shouldn't spend your time in Venice in the hotel room anyway, so I would say it was an overall very pleasant stay, in a truly magnificent city!

Reviews.Title: “Just a short trip from everything!”
Reviews.Author: Gulia9
Reviews.Content: Not only was this hotel very easy to find in the confusing, twisty streets of Venice, it was a great location! It is tucked away between the Per Rialto and the Piazza San Marco, about a 5-minute walk from two of the busiest locations. There are lots of places to shop, grab a bite to eat, and just explore what's nearby. The staff was very nice and the free breakfast was wonderful. It was incredibly wonderful to be able to spend all day out then go back to the hotel to relax before going out again for dinner or a drink. The rooms were very nice, but ask for a room that is NOT overlooking the street because our room was right above the restaurant below so our room smelled like grilled beef EVEN when the windows were CLOSED, so just FYI. Would book again but not with a room that is on the street-side.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value and Great Staff”
Reviews.Author: larry2009NewYork
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Canaletto for 2 nights in this late June. We feel it was a right choice. The staff was very nice and helpful, the room was very clean and comfortable. The hotel is also located just a few minutes walks from St Markâ€˜s Square, Ponte di Rialto, and waterbus stations. In addition to all these positives, I also want to express my appreciation to the staff at Canalletto, especially to Ms. Lara Gobbin. My daughter forgot her necklace in the hotel room when we left Canalleto. When we called the hotel from Florence about the necklace and the staff was extremely nice and helped us to recover it. Ms. Gobbin also very kindly communicated with me several times to give her suggestions on the ways to send the necklace to us. After we returned to US, she mailed the necklace to us safely. We appreciate her help very much. Grazie, Ms. Gobbin and the staff at Hotel Canalleto for your exceptional kindness and help!

Reviews.Title: “Pretty basic but great location, excellent value for money”
Reviews.Author: Baylo1878
Reviews.Content: Just back from a few days at Hotel Canaletto. It's a decent, clean little hotel nicely situated between the Rialto and St Marks. I read a few reviews prior to going about it being difficult to find - if you get off the Vaparetto at Rialto with a half decent map you'll be fine, there are signs for the hotel on the nearest main street to it as well. There's a decent restaurant next door and a few other ok bars and place to eat within a couple of minutes walk. Bedrooms are an ok size althought the shower is a tight squeeze. All very clean though and the staff on reception were friendly enough. Breakfast is very average but you can fill up on the typical ham, cheese, croissant fayre if money is tight. Overall, it's far from luxurious but seemed great value for the price bearing in mind the location. Once you see the prices in some of the bars you'll be glad you went for a budget hotel...

Reviews.Title: “Good 3 star hotel, central location”
Reviews.Author: traveln_t1
Reviews.Content: If you only have a short stay in Venice this hotel is a good 3 star choice. Located just a short walk either way to Rialto or San Marco, the fact that itâ€™s a little hard to find the first time means itâ€™s off the well worn tourist path. It is definitely worth paying a little extra for a canal view - the standard rooms are very small. We were pleasantly surprised with our very spacious room decorated in traditional Venetian style. The living room had a large day bed to relax on while taking in the view and sounds of gondolaâ€™s floating by. We slept soundly in a very comfortable queen bed on the mezzanine level. The bathroom was basic but clean and more than adequate. The hotel would benefit from a bit of a â€œtidy upâ€� in the shared guest areas, however the staff were always friendly and helpful. There is a lovely little ristorante next to the hotel (which we didnâ€™t eat at but the menu looked great), and many other trattorias and cafes close by. It is possible to escape the crowds in Venice and although a little chilly, January has to be one of the best times to explore the many delights and pleasures of this magical place. Spend at least some of your time getting lost amongst the back alleys and canals, pop into a â€œhole in the wallâ€� cafÃ© for an espresso, or aperitivi and cichetti, and for the best (and most economical) way to see the Grand Canal, do the round trip on the no. 2 vaporetto.

Reviews.Title: “Good position but hotel grubby.”
Reviews.Author: moriatika
Reviews.Content: Hotel in a good location near to St Mark's but very hard to find - lost count how many people we asked for directions and Thomsons Travel Agents did not supply any maps or directions! Staff very nice and very helpful. Breakfast was good - although the chairs in the dining room are made for midgets - very low and a shock to sit on if you have long legs! Feel like you are sitting on the floor! The bedroom we had must have been the smallest hotel room on the planet! The bathroom was fairly newly refurbished. The whole hotel could do with a good clean though. The furniture both in the bedrooms and dining room needed a good clean. The back of the bathroom door was disgusting - God knows what spillages had gone on there. The corners of the bathroom floor and the corners of the bath looked as though they had never seen any cleaning materials.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel but watch out your personal belongings”
Reviews.Author: RafaelKon
Reviews.Content: This hotel has a nice location and the room was quite spacious (considering the Venice standards). The breakfast was good and the staff were helpfull (especially Mrs. Lara who gave a lot of information about the city and restaurants...grazie mille) The only disappointment was that somebody stole our umbrellas that were in the reception. We don't know if it was a guest or someone else. However the hotel management could be more strict with the surveillance around the reception area because if someone stole our umbrellas, a notebook or a cellphone could be a next step.

Reviews.Title: “A Nice Place”
Reviews.Author: camlbut
Reviews.Content: We (a family of 4) stayed in this hotel for 2 nights and found it to be comfortable and good value (for Venice anyway). We had a quad room which as expected was not overly roomy but much better than other places we had stayed in. The hotel was very clean and quiet with our room opening onto a small piazza. The bathroom was spotless and the water was hot. Breakfast was quite good: not as sumptious as elsewhere but plenty to fuel our family and the cappuccinos were excellent. I would definitely consider staying here again should I return to Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Nice and Cozy”
Reviews.Author: jerseytraveler82
Reviews.Content: The hotel was a bit hard to find when we got off at the Rialto station - and walking through the 'streets' of Venice with all your luggage searching for the hotel can be no fun - but after finding it, we were pleased. It was off a main road in a quiet square, a nice little restaurant right outside. The staff were helpful and friendly - often speaking to us in English even when we tried speaking with them in Italian! The room was small, but at the end of a long day of traveling and/or sightseeing you don't need much. The bathroom was very tiny though, but made for lots of laughs trying to take a shower and get ready. The breakfast was nice, had a decent spread of food you will find at any continental breakfast in Italy - and the staff was nice enough to give us a "to go" bag when we had to check out early to catch a train - so we could take some food with us as we left! Overall it was nice, but I would probably not choose it again if I returned to Venice

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: innocent_smirf
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for two nights for our honeymoon. The directions on the hotel website meant we found it without too much trouble. The hotel is located off a small street and is only a few minutes walk from both Rialto Bridge and San Mark's Square. There are a lot of restaurants near the hotel as well as cafes, gelaterias, and pizza takeaways. The hotel bedroom was clean and tidy with good air conditioning and a perfectly adequate ensuite. Breakfast was basic but efficient although we found it best to get there before 8.30am for the most choice.

Reviews.Title: “Hard to Find”
Reviews.Author: Shirefamily
Reviews.Content: The hotel was OK for a family of 4. The rooms were comfortable and the shower hot. The breakfast was average but adequate. The staff were helpful. It was just a little hard to find.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Weekend”
Reviews.Author: HooleyPooley
Reviews.Content: Myself and my husband went to Venice to celebrate our first wedding anniversary. We absoloutely loved Venice and will return one day. We would agree with the fact that the hotel is not the easiest to find but getting lost down the small alley's just adds to the fun. The hotel was very clean and comfortable and breakfast was fantastic being plentiful with lots of choice. We arrived after a delayed flight at 10:30 at night during a festival but had no problem getting the public transport to the hotel. The public transport was only 12Euros each from the airport and based on our experience this is the best value for money. We would recommend the hotel and hope you enjoy your holiday to Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Nice small hotel”
Reviews.Author: Bmcll
Reviews.Content: A good location, not real easy to get to with a lot of luggage. Nice, very cute rooms, very clean and polite staff. Nice breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Charming hotel”
Reviews.Author: nieuw
Reviews.Content: We have staid in this hotel for our honeymoon. It is a nice charming hotel, with nicely and special decorated rooms. The rooms are decorated in a venecian way, The hotel is not far from st Marco's square. Although the hotel is quietly situated, it is only a couple of steps away from the center! The staff is friendly and the breakfastroom is nicely decorated too. If you are looking for a not so big and nice hotel, this is the hotel to be in Venice!! S. and. N.Moussir

Reviews.Title: “Dishonest disregard for reservations”
Reviews.Author: tripper tom
Reviews.Content: How would you like to book a room for four nights through the Italian agent, Venere.com, have your confirmation, drag your [----] and your luggage to this place late at night from the airport and have the clerk tell you you no longer have a room or a reservation? We had forwarned the hotel we would be coming in late from the airport. They claimed my reservation was cancelled, but had no proof and I received no email from them or Venere. They steared us to a little hotel for 380 euros($550) a night. They are experts a bait and switch, so be aware!

Reviews.Title: “a little difficult to get to with luggage”
Reviews.Author: travelor96796
Reviews.Content: My friend booked the hotel based on location to the sites from the Rialto bridge to the San Marco square. However, we had the hardest time finding it (thank goodness for its small sign on one of the main streets). The staff is super friendly and helpful. We also had some struggle with getting our luggage to the water bus - thankfully we only had one bridge to cross with it. We had no view and kept the window closed. The room was alright, tight but we were use to the European standards. If I was to visit again, I would probably stay at a hotel closer to the canal/Rialto bridge. For convience of luggage and knowing how to get back to the hotel after visiting sites and getting lost in the maze of streets. We seemed to always by luck find our hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Location Location Location”
Reviews.Author: TravellingTrav
Reviews.Content: Arriving in Venice and very lost, the staff at Hotel Canaletto were very helpful in providing clear instructions on how to find them. A great impression from the start! Very warm and friendly indeed. The hotel itself is located half way between the Rialto Bridge and San Marco square. 5 mins either way. Importantly the walk to San Marco is only 1 or 2 turns, so very easy to remember how to get back! Especially at night after great wine! Our room would have to be described as elegant and almost decadent. It felt the most 'classical Italian' of all the Italy hotels we stayed at. Certainly very clean too. It had a great window but no balcony. The bed was fantastic. Fridge, TV etc. The breakfast was my favorite! Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “didnt love it”
Reviews.Author: baliti
Reviews.Content: Rachel Johnstone Milton Keynes England 30/5/08 If you are lucky to get a big room then that hotel can be given 3 stars, but we ended up with a very stinky tiny room ,then we can give it one star only, great location and very helpfull staff ,but the room took out the fun of it. there are better hotels in the area so why to pay so much for such smelly room?

Reviews.Title: “Nivce Hotel”
Reviews.Author: geofj
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 10 days. Large room with double paned windows to keep out noise, facing canal. Room was newly renovated and nicely decorated. Hotel offers adequate breakfast. Excellent location in quiet campo close to everything. Staff was always pleasant and very helpful in making reservations, contacting shops, and giving directions. They provide their guests with maps. Close to good restaurants. Easy walking distance to many attractions. Hotel is air conditioned although it was not on when we were there. Thoroughly enjoyed hotel and staff and would happily stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great weekend”
Reviews.Author: BedfordshireSue
Reviews.Content: Have just spent a long weekend here. Really good hotel, staff helpful and friendly. Hotel only 5 minutes walk from Rialto Bridge and 10 minutes walk from St Mark's Square. We found it difficult to find, but probably because we expected it to be further away from Rialto than it was. Is in an ideal position for restaurants, shops etc and we have had a weekend to remember. Local restaurants were not as expensive as we expected. Would certainly recommend this hotel. Make sure you get a 72 hour water bus pass, you can even get to Morano Island on this.

Reviews.Title: “a fabulous hotel”
Reviews.Author: sheilasheelagh
Reviews.Content: We really can't fault the Canaletto. The staff were very friendly and helpful, the room was exceptionally clean, spacious and lovely. We didn't really expect a Venetian glass chandelier and painted furniture for the price we paid! One slight quibble - the bed seemed a little short to us (neither of us are unusually tall) so might be a problem if you're over 6ft. The bathroom was also spacious and the heated towel rail kept it cosy. The marble floors were a little cold for February (it probably feels fabulous in the heat of summer), but there was a thermostat to control the heating so not a big problem. The location is also great as it's so close to Rialto and St Marco, but try to get good directions - we went round in circles trying to find it, then realised we'd walked straight past it first time! The breakfast is very plentiful and served till 10.00 which is great if you're not an early riser (as the hotel is so quiet it's easy to sleep in).

Reviews.Title: “What a gem!”
Reviews.Author: TheHaases
Reviews.Content: Canaletto Hotel was truly wonderful. The room was large, spacious, and clean. The furnishings and bed were comfortable and gave us plenty of space for us and our belongings. It looked exactly like the pictures on the hotel website. The bathroom was open and clean, complete with a heated towel rack. The only minor set-back in the bathroom was there wasn't any shower curtain, just a narrow glass like wall. We had to be careful not to flood the bathroom, there was a drain on the floor though, probably for that reason. Housekeeping came by every day with new linens and sheets. The staff was amazing and friendly. Breakfast was fantastic. Every morning there was an array of fresh pastries, jams, cereals, ham and cheese, rolls, juice (including blood orange!), plus they would make you coffee or cappachino any way you wanted it every morning. The hotel offered free wireless internet on their website, but it was either not working or no longer in service when we were there. It wasn't a big deal because they let us the lobby computer with internet for free. The location was terrific. Right between the Rialto Bridge and St. Mark's Square. It was a bit difficult finding it at night, but I was lucky enough to have a very detailed map. There is also a supermarket near the hotel which we went often for snacks and wine. Overall, our stay was excellent and made our honeymoon in Venice terrific.

Reviews.Title: “the best kept secret in venice”
Reviews.Author: Donna46Donna46
Reviews.Content: The best kept secret in Venice. It is difficult to locate - especially the first time, at night. BUT IT WAS SO WORTH IT! Because it is off the main street, and down an out- of- the- way -alley, is the reason it's so quaint and quiet. I was in Italy and Hungary for two weeks and it was the best hotel of all. I loved it. The staff was great. They speak English very well and were very helpful (I had blisters and they even found me band aids!). I hope to go back to Venice and stay in this wonderful hotel - soon.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient and Quiet Hotel”
Reviews.Author: capsfan2002
Reviews.Content: Smaller hotel located off a small square. Located almost in between the Rialto Bridge and St. Mark's Square (I think it's slightly closer to the Rialto). Awoke to the smell of baking bread in the mornings. About 5 minutes walk from the Rialto Bridge and about 10 minutes to St. Mark'sSquare. Waterbus from train station drops you off on the needed side of the Rialto Bridge (just one small bridge to get over with your luggage). Waterbus cost from station is 6 Euros. Rialto stop to/from the Airport (orange line) will require getting your luggage over two small bridges but still very convenient. Cost 12 Euros. The blue line to the Airport leaves from St. Mark's Square if you prefer that. Of course, water taxis also an option if you can afford it. My single room was small but clean and nicely furnished in Venetian style. New flat screen TV in room. 3 English stations (MTV, CNN, BBC). No elevator but does have a wheelchair lift to the 2nd floor; however, parts of the 2nd floor require going up 1 to 2 steps in places. Good, free cold breakfast in the morning; however, when I was there was from 8-10 am only. Not sure if it starts earlier in the summer months. Has 1 computer in lobby for tenant internet use. No internet access in rooms. Fairly modern hair dryers in bathroom. Shower units only (at least in my single room). Friendly and helpful staff. I was in a room facing the Square and found it very quiet. Negatives I found was breakfast not starting until 8 am, lack of internet access in rooms and lack of elevator. Otherwise, a very good property that I would rent from again.

Reviews.Title: “Vallue for money and convenient”
Reviews.Author: 1stclassbackpacka
Reviews.Content: Hotel Canaletto is at a convenient spot- near the Rialto Bridge. We loved this Venician old style-decorated hotel with the lovely Venician glass decor and chandeliers. The staff were very helpful and friendly. There is no lift, so you are required to bring your lugguage up to your room. The rooms are decent, a little bit old, but functional and affordable for a stay in Venice. We had problems with our toilet clogging, but room service fixed it soon enough. Close by to the Rialto Bridge, a lovely Venician restaurant (Barbarino alley?) and supermarket. They include breakfast, which is juice, hot drink, croissants, pastries, cheese, yoghurt, cereal that is self-service. It was a little noisy (as our room faced the road), but not that noticeable and the air-conditioning was difficult to function, but overall, we enjoyed this small hotel.

Reviews.Title: “An excellent introduction to Venice”
Reviews.Author: ShermanLondon
Reviews.Content: Be warned - take a good map before you go! This Hotel can be somewhat tricky to find, but with a good map, it is an absolute pleasure when you do finally stumble upon it. After an hour, we were incredibly lucky to find a local italian who managed to give us precise directions directly to it! Despite our apparent difficulty finding it, the Cannaletto is no harder to find than any other hotel, and is an extremely central, close to all the main attractions. You will spend a lot of your time looking for things, but no matter how lost you get, you will always come across a familiar landmark and the town is sprawling with signs to guide tourists from A to B. This hotel was everything we had hoped for. Checking-in was effortless, and our room was absolutely beautiful, and much larger than we had expected. The decor is typically Venetian, and will please any couple, whether you're on a casual romantic getaway or a honeymoon. The room came equipped with a lovely bathroom (including an actual bath!) a television (although I'm sure you won't use it) as well as the cheapest mini bar I have ever come across in Italy! The staff were always friendly and keen to help, and the breakfast was good. I absolutely recommend this hotel for anyone wanting a memorable experience in the heart of Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay !”
Reviews.Author: BiagiodiMaratea
