Reviews.Content: We stayed three nights at the Canaletto Hotel (room 21). Very quiet hotel, although centrally located in between St. Marks Square and Rialto bridge. Friendly and helpful staff, good breakfast. Excellent place to stay. We'll be back !

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel of My European Trip”
Reviews.Author: RaleighRob
Reviews.Content: Of my whole European Trip, this was the best hotel we stayed in. Big bed, large room, great view, quiet room (it's sound-proofed, apparently). The large modern bathroom (with bidet, marble shower and big sink) was great too. And it had good air-conditioning too. A nice buffet breakfast as well. Good location. Friendly, bilingual staff. Decor is a little much, but it's Venice, afterall. The only downside to the whole place was that the floor was a slippery linoleum...so keep that in mind. Otherwise, the perfect hotel.

Reviews.Title: “very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: sinusqueen
Reviews.Content: Good location- close to St. Marks. Great room on the canal- huge for European standards! Very helpful staff, internet access, good breakfast. Would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Value”
Reviews.Author: Jenny_in_DC
Reviews.Content: The hotel was outstanding-- a short walk to the best attractions of Venice, but still in a quiet side street. That said, it was a bit difficult to find, so be sure to use San Leo as a landmark while traveling. The hotel staff was very helpful, polite, and spoke at least English, Italian, and French. The breakfast buffet was quite good, as well. We reccommend using the veneziasi.it website for booking any hotel in florence. Great prices and one-stop-shopping for information and availability.

Reviews.Title: “A Jewel in Venice”
Reviews.Author: Burfordcobb
Reviews.Content: The Canaletto Hotel is situated behind a modest faÃ§ade on a quiet route by a canal just mid-way between the two great centres of Venice, the Rialto and San Marco. This is ideal for us for we have been regular participants in the Venice Carnival since 1995, and we were very fortunate to find the Canaletto at the start. We have always stayed there since, which is in itself a recommendation, and we have never had the slightest reason to go anywhere else in Venice. The hotel has real Venetian qualities - the rooms are clean, quiet and comfortable with wide beds, and are elegant in the Venetian way with glass chandeliers and characteristic decor. The en-suite bathrooms are well equipped, modern and efficient with plentiful hot water. The breakfast buffet is ample with many choices. Over the years we have noticed the continuity of the staff, which is always a good sign. They are invariably cheerful, kind and helpful in every way and have become our very good friends. We are just back from a stay there of nearly three weeks for the Carnival of 2007 and we look forward to next year. If our diary will allow it we shall return to the Canaletto in the autumn. A whole-hearted commendation!

Reviews.Title: “Cozy little hotel”
Reviews.Author: Ebocrombi
Reviews.Content: I have just returned with my boyfriend from a 3 night stay in this hotel, and I have to say it offers real value for your money. It is centrally located, but in a very quiet street; it is very clean, the staff members are friendly, and the rooms are small but comfortable. The bathroom looked like new. I have stayed there during some very cold winter days, so the perfectly working heating was something I really aprecciated... Breakfast is simple but tasty, and they offer you REAL coffee (not the usual insipid machine coffee). I really enjoyed my stay at the Canaletto, and I would definitely stay there again. It's a very nice place to sleep after a long day of walking around the beautiful city of Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value for money”
Reviews.Author: Nick&AnneHereford
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Canaletto with 2 friends between Jan 9th and 12th 2007. The hotel location is ideal for visiting all the sights. The rooms are small but the decor is of a very good standard and the bathrooms were very clean. We would recommend this hotel for a short break. Overall excellent value for money

Reviews.Title: “Clean hotel, hard to find”
Reviews.Author: swatts1
Reviews.Content: 7 people recently visited Italy. We had 3 rooms: 2 doubles and 1 triple. The Canaletto was difficult to find, but once there we were checked in right away. The double rooms were on the same hall and the triple was on the same floor but further down. After reading reviews here, we expected a slightly more updated hotel. The double rooms were fairly small, but clean and roomy enough to open two suitcases. The bath had modern fixtures. Linens were clean. There was a shortage of outlets and they were difficult to access. We had a street view from the shuttered window. The triple room was quite a surprise. It was a 2 level room with a very large, modern bathroom and a sitting area downstairs, which contained a day bed. Upstairs was a king bed plus a pull out trundle under the main bed. Storage was more than ample and this room had many outlets for rollers, camera chargers, etc. The room looked out on a canal and was very picturesque. We were thankful that this room was available to our party as we used it as a gathering place for the group. Breakfast was adequate with assorted pastries, cereal and juice. The waitresses made an effort to remember our beverage preferences and were very pleasant and accommodating. English was spoken by most hotel employees and the desk person assisted us in arranging for a water taxi to get the group to the train station upon checkout. The dock behind the hotel was being used for garbage pickup so the doorman helped us get our luggage to a nearby dock and also helped load all of our belongings into the water taxi. We would return to the Canaletto if looking for a well priced clean hotel. Its location was very good - near to the Rialto Bridge as well as Piazza San Marco. My main complaint was that the hotel was too hot. The only way that we could stay cool was to keep the window open which allowed street noise and a overwhelming woodsmoke smell.

Reviews.Title: “Venice our favorite - Cannaletto great!”
Reviews.Author: SCS-TRIP
Reviews.Content: We (two families traveling together requiring a double and two tripples) just returned from Italy and the Canaletto was one of the reasons that Venice was our favorite! This little hotel was tucked away, off the main tourist street, but only about half a block to a main street. To reach the hotel we arrived at Venice airport and took the Alilaguna to the San Marco stop. From there it is a short walk of about 3 blocks. Just be sure to get the directions before you go so that you don't have to depend on others for directions. The young woman who checked us in was very helpful with maps, directions to restaurants, transportation information and in general anything that we needed. The rooms were very clean and the bathrooms modern and marble. Each morning we awoke to the wonderful aroma of baking croissants! Breakfast was quite good and the breakfast room attendant was pleasant and always helpful in meeting our needs. The only problem that we had was that there is a major renovation going on next door to the hotel and they worked through the night with loud misic playing for most of the time on one or two of the nights that we were there. On the night without misic it was perfectly quiet and very comfortable. We would definitely stay at the Canaletto again!

Reviews.Title: “Wow!”
Reviews.Author: maljeff
Reviews.Content: Just returned from Italy with my family of 4. We stayed here while in Venice for 2 nights. What a room! It was 2 levels with 2 large windows overlooking a canal. We loved it. My daughter felt like she was in a palace. Would recommend this hotel. Great location. Very clean and adaquate breakfast.

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel Canaletto
HotelInfo.Address: Castello 5487, 30122 Venice, Italy
